column4: Hi! Is this the right place to ask about encountering an issue upgrading from karmic koala to lucid lynx? I'm using a laptop and use ubuntu along with windows 7 if that helps.
yes, this is the right place, please ask directly, don't ask to ask
i honestly recommend doing a CLEAN install
separate your / and your /home/ and the next time, you won't have to save anything in an external drive, just make sure you don't format /home/
I'm sorry what are these slashes?
those slashes are the UNIX paths to files
think of / as C:\ in Windows
/home/ is similar to saying C:\Documents and Settings\
oh
but then where do i do that?
at the installation, configure manually your disks, and set / and /home separately.
/home/ needs the most space
with let's say 50 GB in /, you'll be totally okay
Oh... but actually I already have 30GB for ubuntu and i still have a lot left
oh, well in that case, assign at least 5, or 10% of your HDD space to /
/home/ is where you save EVERYTHING, related to your user
/ is for sys config files, packages and system-wide themes
so what I understand from you is that in any case, i better do a fresh install? am i right?
yes, and with your separate /home, you will be able to do clean installs without losing data, apart from installed packages
because your program settings, for your user are saved in /home/
google for "separate home partition linux" for more
I see. Well, thank you Beyecixramd
you're welcome :)
